Book.Title: Algorithms
Book.Annotation: This text, extensively class-tested over a decade at UC Berkeley and UC San Diego, explains the fundamentals of algorithms in a story line that makes the material enjoyable and easy to digest. Emphasis is placed on understanding the crisp mathematical idea behind each algorithm, in a manner that is intuitive and rigorous without being unduly formal.

Book.Title: AI Algorithms, Data Structures, and Idioms in Prolog, Lisp, and Java
Book.Annotation: This book illustrates how to program AI algorithms in Lisp, Prolog, and Java. The book basically cover each topic 3 times in each language. Topics include: simple production-like system based on logic, logic-based learning, and natural language parsing.

Book.Title: The Black Art of Programming
Book.Annotation: This book is an introduction to computer programming. It covers the essential information of a Computer Science course. It is recommended for beginners and intermediate programmers.

Book.Title: Microsoft's Windows AppStudio
Book.Annotation: This EBook is the result of a challenge, to integrate Azure Mobile Service with Windows AppStudio Applications from the Windows AppStudio Team.

Book.Title: Step into Windows Phone 8
Book.Annotation: This book is written for the beginners who are thinking to start learning Windows Phone 8 Development.

Book.Title: New Features in C# 6.0
Book.Annotation: In this book we are going to learn new features of C# 6.0 which are introduced by the Microsoft.
